Generation I.Red: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
Generation I.Yellow: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
Generation I.Stadium: If at all possible, it will try to avoid battles. Small or weak enemies are blown away by Whirlwind .

Generation II.Gold: It usually hides in tall grass. Because it dislikes fighting, it protects itself by kicking up sand.
Generation II.Silver: Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand.
Generation II.Crystal: It rapidly flaps its wings in the grass, stirring up a dust cloud that drives insect prey out into the open.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It usually hides in tall grass. Because it dislikes fighting, it protects itself by kicking up sand. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
Generation III.Sapphire: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
Generation III.Emerald: It has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It can unerringly return home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
Generation III.FireRed: Does not like to fight. It hides in tall grass and so on, foraging for food such as small bugs.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.
